title: Drawing, "Two Cupids Kissing", 1750–90
medium: Pen and brown and black ink on white laid paper, mounted on heavy white laid paper
markings:
Collector's mark: J. Peoli [Lugt 2020]
Cooper Union Museum for the Arts of Decoration [Lugt 457c]
signed: Signed in pen and brown ink, lower center of drawing:  Tommaso Todeschini
inscribed: Inscribed on verso of mount in pen and black ink, lower right:  g(L?) R
provenance:
Collection of Juan Jorg Peoli (1825-1893), no. 588
Gamage collection (according to old label on verso of drawing)
description: A male and female cupid in the form of a sculpted group. The female sits upon a stone on which the male cupid kneels on his left leg.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Two Cupids Kissing", 1750–90.
1750–90. Pen and brown and black ink on white laid paper, mounted on heavy white laid paper. Gift of Miss Duer. 1898-15-1.
